content: Pixel 8 Pro reviewâ€”The best Android phone.
The photos are good, but videography disappoints. Battery is average.
Google Pixel 8 Pro long-term review: Improved in almost every area.
Pixel 8 review: Google's smaller, longer-lasting Android.
Pixel 8 user can now enjoy VITURE XR glasses with the display out functionality.
Pixel 8 Pro review: picture perfect, pesky pricing.
Design - The most comfortable and best-looking flagship.
I'm delighted by this thing it's refreshing.
The Pixel 8 is a flagship with 7 years of updates, the best phone photography, and solid hardware. The price is insane!
As a Pixel series fan, I think that the Pixel 8 Pro is too expensive for what you get, even with the updates.
The Pixel 8 has a better main camera with 21% more light sensitivity than the Pixel 7. It also has a great ultrawide.
Iphone 8 makes worse photos at the day time that Pixel at night. This is a great upgrade.
The Pixel is superior, I would recommend Pixel 8 Pro, because you get similar CPU and GPU performance.
The Pixel 8 Pro has same performance and the same 7 Years of updates, the performance is really amazing.
So I settled for the Pixel because of the marvelous reviews on its camera and general usage.
Updates come much quicker and with fewer issues with Pixels. The camera is one of the best in the market.
This Pixel generation feels right alongside other flagships. It's a definitive step in the right direction.
I'm glad the magic editor works as advertised. Hopefully, it comes to older Tensor phones like my P7P.
The Pixel 8 looks solid. I wish the review covered cellular performance and throttling more in-depth.
The fingerprint reader hasn't improved which is disappointing. I wanted a smaller size and better sensor.
The reviewer mentioned the 8 and 8 Pro share selfie cameras, but is this information accurate?
This review makes the Pixel 8 Pro look like a solid generation. Nothing seems to be holding it back.
I'm switching from a S23U to an 8 Pro, but now I'm wondering if the regular 8 would have been better.
The Pixel Pro 8 arrived today, and I'm loving it so far. The hardware feels much better than the 7 Pro.
The fingerprint sensor is pretty bad. Ultrasonic sensors on Samsung and OnePlus are the better option.
I don't like locking software features to differentiate the Pro and non-Pro versions. That is not good.
I don't like the 'fix it in post' theme of the review. It veils the praise for the phone.
It feels bad that I spent $1079 on the Pixel 8 Pro. It seems to have a 3-year-old processor.
We can like the device but still objectively be critical of its processor's capabilities and performance.
The chipset is underpowered. I'd prefer paying more for a Dimensity 8xxx or 9xxx processor.
Forcing the screen refresh rate to 120hz makes the phone smoother. Auto mode isn't optimized at all.
I'm thinking of getting this for my dad he wants a phone with a good camera and battery life.
I can't decide between this and the Pixel 8a. I want stock Android and long-term updates.
Why does the interface slow down so much? The animations lag a lot of the time.
Screen colors are too saturated or dull. Is there a way to tweak individual RGB values?
Pixel's software is so good, I wish the hardware competed with iPhone and Galaxy phones.
I can run Genshin on my P8P at ~40FPS, which is good. I hope Google competes with their SoCs.
Software optimization for games is a pain. This will be fixed, but never buy on a promise.
The fingerprint scanner feels the same. At least now we have face unlock functionality available.
I don't get heat issues and fingerprint scanner issues. All phones get hot when used for a while.
